alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Mason; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 3:42PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Calhoun, southern Ritchie, southeastern Mason, northeastern Cabell, west central Doddridge, northwestern Kanawha, Putnam, Wirt, western Roane, Jackson and south central Wood Counties through 430 PM EST... At 342 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ripley, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Ripley, Spencer, Winfield, Harrisville, Elizabeth, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Eleanor, Buffalo, Pennsboro, Poca, Sandyville, Cross Lanes, Kenna, Teays Valley, North Bend State Park and Bancroft. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 105 and 147, between mile markers 154 and 157, and between mile markers 161 and 162. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 34 and 49. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 43 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
